title: Why are the students from ucla so bad at tennis?
self_text: I have been playing tennis for 10 years and just started college this year. But there is a clear gap between the players at UCLA and other schools. The most obvious difference is the lack of consistency in their shots. They don't seem to know how to be consistent, as they often hit balls that go out or miss the target completely. They also seem to not know what to do when an opponent comes up on them, but then immediately lose composure and start to panic. It's frustrating to watch, and it makes me wonder why they can't improve.

title: I just did the 2023 Fall Update!
self_text: This is a great update and it's well worth the time invested in doing it. You don't need to do anything except follow the instructions on the website and it'll be done automatically for you.  I have an email from them saying that my new student ID will be available next week, but it also said they will send me my old ID card with the updated information printed on it.  My classes are all set up now too and there's no confusion about what times/days to attend which is good.  The important thing is that you're registered and ready to go so let's not worry about it too much.  Also, your transcripts will be sent out as soon as possible after the registration is complete.  You can access your transcript at the following link: https://www.ucla.edu/transcript   I hope this helps!  Did anyone else get their updated info?

title: The first time I saw a girl with big thighs, she was wearing some tight jeans and her legs looked like they were going to snap right through the denim! She was also wearing some heels which made them look even more prominent, and I couldn't take my eyes off of her. It wasn't just the size of her thighs that turned me on; it was how they looked in those jeans and heels. The way they moved as she walked, the curve of her calf muscles, and the overall effect was simply mesmerizing. I didn't know what to do but I wanted to tell her how beautiful she looked. But then she got angry at me because she thought I was trying to hit on her, so I had to leave immediately. The first time I saw a girl with big thighs, she was wearing some tight jeans and her legs looked like they were going to snap right through the denim! She was also wearing some heels which made them look even more prominent, and I couldn't take my eyes off of her. It wasn't just the size of her thighs that turned me on; it was how they looked in those jeans and heels. The way they moved as she walked, the curve of her calf muscles, and the overall effect was simply mesmerizing. I didn't know what to do but I wanted to tell her how beautiful she looked. But then she got angry at me because she thought I was trying to hit on her, so I had to leave immediately.  I tried to find her again but I couldn't. When I finally did, she told me that she was about to go out for dinner with her friends, and she was not interested in me or anyone else.   I felt terrible after hearing her words, especially because I was so excited about her. But I knew that I should have been respectful of her feelings, and I apologized to her for being such a creep. Then I went home and cried myself to sleep. I spent the rest of the night wondering why she was so upset. Was she offended by my attention? Or was she afraid of something? And if she was scared, why didn't she tell me? I don't think I will ever understand why she reacted the way she did. But it is important for me to remember this experience and learn from my mistakes. I must be more careful when approaching women, and I must respect their boundaries. If you want to help me become a better man, please give me advice on how to handle these situations in the future. I am willing to try anything. Thank you for your understanding. title: Can anyone help me with my chemistry homework?
self_text: I have a few questions that i don't understand and can't figure out how to solve.  Question 1 : In a sample of water, if we increase the temperature from 25 degrees Celsius to 100 degrees Celsius, what is the change in energy? Answer : The amount of energy required to raise the temperature of 1g of water from 25 degrees C to 100 degrees C is 76.3 J/g.   Question 2 : A student has a piece of metal that he believes is iron. He weighs it on a balance scale and finds that it weighs 84 grams. If iron has a density of 7.87 g/mL, what is the volume of the metal? Answer : Volume = mass / density = 84g / 7.87g/mL = 10.6 mL  Question 3 : How many molecules of oxygen are contained in a sample of air that has a pressure of 101 kPa at a temperature of 25°C? Answer : Pressure = 101 kPa; Temperature = 25°C; R = 8.314 J/molK; Molar Mass of Oxygen = 16 g/mol  Question 4 : Why do people say that the atmosphere is like a blanket? Answer : Atmosphere is like a blanket because it contains gases that trap heat from the sun. Without them, the Earth would be too cold for life to exist. So they work as insulation to keep us warm. Question 5 : Explain why ice floats in water. Answer : Ice floats in water because ice is less dense than liquid water.  Can someone please explain why these answers are wrong?

title: How do I make a good roommate relationship?
self_text: We all want to make our college experience the best it can be.  And making an excellent roommate relationship is very important for that reason.   It's not always easy, but it’s possible with some effort from both sides. Here are some tips on how to create a good roommate relationship:  1. Discuss Expectations Early On.   When you first meet your roommate, have a conversation about what matters most to each of you and how you plan to live together. Don’t wait until the day you move in to start talking.  2.  Be Respectful.   Respect your roommate’s privacy, space, belongings, and schedule.   3. Communicate Openly and Honestly.  If something bothers you or if you need help, let your roommate know as soon as possible.  4. Be Flexible.   Life happens, so sometimes things won’t go according to plan. It’s important to be flexible and willing to compromise.  5. Spend Time Together.  Even if you don’t always agree on everything, spending time together can help build a strong bond.  6. Support Each Other.   Support your roommate when they’re struggling and celebrate their successes.  7. Don’t Assume.  Don’t assume you know what your roommate wants or needs.  8. Give Space When Needed.   Sometimes people just need some alone time.  9.  Clean Up After Yourself.   This is a basic rule of living with anyone, but it’s especially important when sharing a room or apartment.  10. Be Considerate.   Consider your roommate’s feelings and needs when making decisions.  Here are some other tips to consider:   - Create a shared calendar to keep track of schedules. - Set ground rules for guests. - Establish a cleaning routine. - Have regular check-ins to discuss any concerns.   Creating a good roommate relationship takes work, but it can pay off big time. If you follow these tips, you’ll increase your chances of having a positive and enjoyable living experience.  Thanks for reading!   I’m here to answer any questions you may have.  Let me know if there is anything else I can help you with.  #College #Roommates #Relationships #Living #Tips #Help #Advice

title: How do I make a perfect cup of coffee?
self_text: Okay, so for the sake of argument, let’s assume that you have all of these items in your kitchen and are making a cup of coffee as we speak.   What is the most important thing to consider when making coffee?   For me, it would be temperature.  The water needs to be hot enough to extract flavor from the coffee beans but not so hot that it burns them. It's often suggested that the ideal temperature is between 195°F and 205°F (90°C - 96°C). This is because at those temperatures, the volatile aromatic compounds in the coffee will be extracted efficiently without over-extracting the bitter flavors. But how do you know if the water is the right temperature? You can use a thermometer to check, or simply watch for small bubbles forming on the bottom of the pot.   But what about grind size? The best grind size depends on the brewing method you're using. For example, French press requires a coarse grind, while espresso requires a fine grind. What's the perfect grind size for pour over?   Also, I’m just starting out, so I don’t want to waste too much money by buying fancy equipment. Any tips or suggestions?

title: I feel like the students are just being a little bit more rude and mean lately
self_text: I had an issue with my roommate last week that made me have to be on lockdown for two days. I was not allowed to go outside or talk to anyone, so I ended up having to do all of my schoolwork in the library during times where there were people working and studying. Then I came back to find out my roommates had left without telling me, which made me feel like they didn't respect me as a human.  I then got accused of being a bad roommate because I told them that they should have said something when they left. When I told them how it made me feel, they laughed at me and said that it wasn't my fault. So I ended up feeling like I can't trust them, but they don't want me to leave either. I think I need to move somewhere else if possible. But I don't know what to do. It feels like everything is going wrong. I am also kind of worried about getting kicked out. Is it possible for a student to get kicked out of college? Also, I hate the idea of moving because it will make things even harder for me.

title: 10 year old’s first time on the bus?
self_text: Just saw a 10 year old kid in the front seat of the bus and he was freaking out because the bus driver didn't say “here we go” like how he does to the older kids. The kid looked at his mom and asked “why doesn’t he say here we go?”   I told him that is what they say when the bus is going to start moving but it’s not really a thing. The mom responded with "you don't have to tell them about the bus" lol. I felt bad for the little guy, it must be super confusing. He then started crying and she gave him her phone so he could watch youtube.

title: [x] is the best way to start a game and win.
self_text: I hate when people start a game with their hands on the keyboard and they aren’t trying to improve their skills. You can play with your hands for a bit, but you will quickly lose against someone who uses the keyboard. It’s not about how many times you have played before, or how long you have been playing. The key to winning games like these is to learn the maps and strategies, because most players are going to be using the keyboard.  So basically if you want to win in these types of games, you should practice your hand placement and use that to make more decisions than someone that isn't.

self_text: I'm on the waitlist for an A&P class and my dad just told me that if i don't get into the class, he won't be paying for it anymore. He said i should pay out of pocket but I'm really worried about how much it will cost and what else I need to do to get accepted.  I was wondering if there are any scholarships that I can still apply for if i'm on the waitlist. Any help is appreciated!

title: How does the college get their $160,000+ tuition money?
self_text: I'm just curious about how the university gets so much of its revenue from students and alumni. I know they have endowments and other investments but that doesn't explain it.  I also know some people are saying that the school is basically running on student debt. So what is the breakdown for tuition, donations, endowment investment returns, etc.?

title: What are the differences between CS240 and CS188?
self_text: I'm a sophomore who is trying to decide which class to take next semester. The difference in prerequisites seem to be that CS240 requires you to know C++, while CS188 requires you to know Java, but I don't have any experience with either of those languages.  I'm also curious about what topics these classes cover.  I've heard CS240 covers more advanced concepts, such as design patterns, concurrency, etc., but I'm not sure if it's worth taking it before having some experience with programming. Is there anything I should consider?

title: When do we get to know the ending of the series?
self_text: I have been watching this show for so long now, and it's starting to feel like there is no ending. I just want to know how it ends and when!  Is it after the last episode? Is it a movie or something? What about the sequel? How can I be sure that I will know how it all ends? I am not looking forward to having to wait longer than necessary because I was already waiting so long in the first place.

title: I'm not sure if i should be worried, but recently I haven't been able to think about anything but my ex and the fact that he broke up with me?
self_text: I had a great relationship with him for almost two years until he said "I don't love you anymore" a few months ago and ended it?  It happened out of nowhere and there was no bad blood between us. It just...ended.  Now ever since, I can't stop thinking about him and what we did together. The other day when I was eating dinner, I was so upset that I started crying because I wanted to have some more of his favorite dish.  Also, I keep replaying our old memories in my head over and over again. Like, I'll be walking down the street or doing something mundane and suddenly I'll think about how much fun we had playing board games or how good he looked on the beach last summer.  I know it isn't healthy to dwell on things like this, but I've tried to distract myself with work/school and friends, but nothing seems to help.  I want to move on but it feels impossible.  Is this normal? Should I do anything about it? Is there any way to make it stop?

title: The best way to get out of the dorms is by moving into a house with friends?
self_text: I'm looking for advice on how to move out from my dorm room, since I don't really like living in the dorms anymore and I need a quiet place to study.

title: When did you start using the new student portal?
self_text: Hi! I am a freshman and I was wondering when you started using the new student portal (the website). My friend says it is confusing and hard to use so I wanted to know if there are any tips or tricks to making it easier for me to navigate. Thanks!

title: I’m so confused about the different types of college essays and how they work.
self_text: I've been working on my college application essays for months now, but I still don’t really know what a personal statement is vs a supplemental essay vs an activity essay. I know that it's supposed to tell a story or show some aspect of your character, but I’m struggling to think of something that would make me stand out without being a complete lie. Is there anything specific you guys recommend?

title: How to get rid of a stubborn smell?
self_text: I have an old room in my house with an odor that won't go away. It smells like mildew and dampness. I cleaned the floor, walls, windows, ceiling, furniture, and even scrubbed the rugs. After cleaning, I left a box of baking soda in there for a week, but it didn't help.  I tried opening windows and fans to let the air flow through the room, but nothing seems to work. The odor is persistent. I don't want to spend too much money on professional cleaning services, so I was hoping someone could give me some advice. Any tips or tricks would be greatly appreciated!

title: The 3rd person of a group is being bullied by the rest
self_text: We had 4 people in our group and there was a 3rd person who would get picked on for not being good at a game like Valorant. They'd often have to be replaced because they were losing so much. It got to the point where they were constantly being yelled at or ridiculed. I asked them if they wanted me to stop playing with them, but they said that it didn't matter and that they just wanted the others to leave them alone. The other two didn't care about what happened either, as long as they could win.  I tried to tell the bullies that it wasn't okay to treat someone like that, but they laughed in my face. So I ended up stopping myself from doing anything because I felt useless and I didn't want to make things worse. What can I do? How can I help them without getting involved? Is it wrong to ignore it?

title: UCD, I need a place to stay
self_text: I’m an international student from the Philippines and I will be arriving in Dublin on December 19th, 2023.  I was hoping that someone could help me with finding accommodation.   I have already tried websites like Airbnb and Booking.com but they are full.  The closest thing I can find is a hostel which is not really what I am looking for.

My major is Computer Science, and I am taking a lot of classes for my degree. But I'm not sure how to get a foot in the door with no prior work experience.

I had a good grade last semester, so I thought I'd have some confidence going into this class, but now I am just wondering if I should drop out of the class altogether.  What are your thoughts?

Do I have to call them or is there something else I need to do?  I would also like to know how long it takes to get your new license after submitting your application and payment.  Thank you!

title: No more bobs, no more bobs.
self_text: The only thing that's good about the new policy is that it'll make us be more mindful of what we do.  I think that everyone should have a little bit of time off on a regular basis.  It's not like we're working in an office setting where we need to be available at all times.  We're not doctors or lawyers; we don't need to be available around the clock.  If you're feeling burnt out, you should take some time off and relax.  Your mental health matters, so please take care of yourself.

title: how to get the best out of your time here at ucla?
self_text: Hey! I'm a new student and would love to get the most out of my experience here at UCLA. I've been trying to find ways to get involved in campus life, but it feels like everything is happening at once.  I was wondering if anyone could give me any tips on how to make the most of my time here, especially with the amount of work/school that i'll be doing.  Do you have any recommendations for clubs, organizations, events, or anything else?

self_text: Just wanted to get my thoughts out and ask if anyone can help me figure out how to improve my academic performance. I've been having a really rough time in school lately, and it feels like everything is going wrong for me. My mental health has been declining as well due to the stress of school.  I just don't know what to do anymore and I feel so hopeless. Please share your experiences and advice!

title: "A good way to make money"
self_text: I’m a freshman at UCLA and I was wondering if anyone could recommend any legitimate ways to make money around campus.  I would be willing to do almost anything, but don't want to get scammed or have to go through a lot of hassle.  Also, I’d like to make enough to pay for my expenses, so $20-50/hr is ideal.   I’ve tried some things in the past (tutoring) but they didn’t work out.  Any advice?

title: How to pick the perfect college?
self_text: What are the factors you consider when choosing a college? I'm just trying to figure out what should be important in my decision making process so that I don't make a mistake later on.  Here is a list of factors I've been considering.   Academics - Quality of school, specific programs (if any)   Location - proximity to home, climate   Size - small or large   Cost - tuition/fees, living expenses   Social Life - diversity, extracurriculars, etc.   Career opportunities - internship and job prospects   Facilities - dorms, labs, gym   Campus culture - vibe, student body, clubs   Future plans - potential career paths   I am looking for advice from those who have gone through the college selection process, especially those who made the wrong choice.  What do you think I should focus on?

title: How much money do I have to make?
self_text: I'm not sure if I should give up my job and become a full time streamer, so how much money do I need to make to be able to live off it?

title: How to get into a good college
self_text: I'm currently in 10th grade and would like some advice on how to get into a good college. I have no idea where to start and it is so overwhelming.  I have great grades, but they are not the best, and I am starting my journey of getting accepted to a university. I will be in the top 5% of my class as well as being a part of the honor roll every year. My GPA is around 3.8 or higher.  What steps do you think I should take?  Should I focus on AP courses, and what AP courses do you think I should take? What can I do to improve my chances of getting into a good college? Thanks!

title: The 2023 Annual Scholarship Award Ceremony
self_text: The annual scholarship award ceremony is on November 18th at 6 pm in the auditorium.  The awards will be given to students who have been nominated by their professors and coaches.   I’m not sure how to get a nomination but I know that it’s a good thing to ask for.  They are looking for people with outstanding academic records, leadership skills, and community involvement.  There will be a buffet dinner and music.  If you would like to attend please sign up by November 10th.  https://www.ucla.edu/studentlife/programs/annual-scholarship-award-ceremony/  What do you think?

title: Can I apply to UCLA with a non-US high school diploma?
self_text: Yes, you can still apply to UCLA even if your high school diploma is not from the US!  I just graduated from a foreign high school and my parents are permanent residents of the United States so they decided that I should apply to UCLA but my mom wants me to go to a university that has less competition for international students and she also thinks that it will be easier for me to get in.  I have a 4.0 GPA, all A's and B's, and I scored very well on the SAT.  What do you guys think about applying to UCLA with my non-US high school diploma?  Also, what kind of advice would you give me?

self_text: Anyone got a good study guide for the exam? I’m struggling to remember all of the processes and what they do, it's very confusing.  What topics should I focus on?  I also want to know what kind of questions are going to be asked in the exam. Are there any common mistakes that people make on the exam? What is the expected difficulty of the exam?

title: I think the issue is with the server because i can't access my student account from outside the network and it says "access denied" when trying to log in but it works from inside the network
self_text: My name is Alex, and I am an incoming freshman in UCLA.  I'm having trouble logging into my student account. When I try to log in from outside of the UCLA campus network (i.e., using my phone), I get an error message that says "Access Denied." However, when I'm on the UCLA Wi-Fi network, it lets me log in without any problems.   I have been troubleshooting for a few days now, and I have tried all the common solutions: resetting my password, checking my email for phishing scams, verifying that my username is correct, etc.   The problem is that I don't know how to troubleshoot further, and I'm not sure if it's something on my end or something on UCLA's side.   Can anyone help?  Thanks!

title: Why is the university still not giving out a 404 error?
self_text: My university just released an email about a new rule that states that students can only get up to 15 credits in any single semester, and they are trying to enforce it by claiming there is no longer a way to see how many credits I have taken on my degree audit because it was removed from the system.  I clicked on the link provided in the email (a link to the degree audit) which brought me to a page with the following error message: "Page Not Found - 404"   This seems ridiculous because the page exists, and I've been able to access it successfully for years.  Is this a legitimate issue or a lie to make people think they need to take fewer courses so the university can force them into taking more expensive classes?

title: [17] I'm really sorry, but I just want to say that I'm not going to be able to make the next round of finals for my class. There are a few reasons why (family matters) and it's not something I can share with you all. I am very sorry if I have to give up on my position or my goals for now.
self_text: No worries, nothing is lost if you miss out! Just take care of yourself and don't feel bad about it.  I know there will be other opportunities in life.  You need time to do things right and focus on what you want. It doesn't matter how long it takes, as long as you reach your goals.   It's great that you're giving me a heads-up and letting me know so I can plan accordingly. Thanks for being honest and genuine. You've made a big difference in my life and I appreciate you helping me get where I am today.    I believe that we should all treat each other with kindness and respect. That's how we can build a better world together.  We need to support each other and help those who are struggling. It doesn't matter whether they are friends or strangers; everyone deserves our compassion. If someone needs help, we should offer it. But also, people should learn to handle their problems themselves and work toward making a positive change in their lives. We shouldn't depend on others for everything. People should stand up for themselves and fight for their own happiness. Everyone has dreams and goals, so they should strive to achieve them. They should always try to become better versions of themselves.   It's important to remember that everyone makes mistakes. Let's not judge anyone based on their errors. Instead, let's offer forgiveness and guidance.   Thanks again for sharing your thoughts and feelings. I hope to hear from you soon.   Let's stay connected and keep supporting each other!    Sincerely,  \[Your Name]

title: How do you feel about the new and improved ucla campus?
self_text: I just got back from a trip to visit UCLA campus. I was visiting my sister who is now a student there, so I had a chance to experience it first hand.  I’m still in the process of applying for schools, but UCLA has been on my list for a long time now.  I visited during their fall orientation week, and it seemed like a pretty busy place, with lots of students doing stuff. The campus itself seems nice, with plenty of green space and some cool buildings.  However, I also noticed that it can be quite crowded, especially around the main quad. It felt like every single square inch was occupied by students or visitors. I think the sheer size of the university means that it’s difficult to get away from the crowds, even if you want to.  But overall, the campus does seem really impressive. The architecture is beautiful, and the location is fantastic—right near Westwood Village, which has tons of restaurants and shops.  I'd probably have to go back and visit again sometime to check out the other parts of the campus. What do you guys think of the new and improved UCLA campus? Do you like how they are improving it? Would you recommend a visit?

title: How do I get to the University of California, Los Angeles?
self_text: Here is how you can get to UCLA from Los Angeles International Airport (LAX):  1) Take the LAX FlyAway bus to Union Station. The ride takes about 70 minutes and costs $13.50. From Union Station, take the Metro Red Line to Vermont/Sunset station, which is a 20-minute ride and costs $1.50. Then walk for 8 minutes to reach the campus. 2) Take an Uber or Lyft from LAX to UCLA. The ride takes about 40 minutes and costs around $20-$30 depending on traffic conditions. 3) Take the AirRail to Westwood Station, which is about 6 minutes and costs $8. You can then transfer to the Metro Red Line, which will bring you to Vermont/Sunset Station. This route takes approximately 15 minutes and costs $1.50. After arriving at Vermont/Sunset Station, walk for 8 minutes to reach the campus.
